body: Hi guys, First I'd like to thank Mostapha, Chris, Mingbo and everyone who made LB+HB in general, and the last release in particular, available to us all.  I have a specific question related to HDR images, output from Radiance (or not necessarily in my case, but processed using Radiance/pcomb). Has anyone tried to apply bespoke or unusual gradient palettes to their false-colour images ? It would be so great to be able to process images like grids, using a preset library much like this: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/blob/master/resources/g...](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/blob/master/resources/gradients.jpg) I used to use the 5 available palettes described in A. Jacob's Radiance Cookbook (+ bespoke ones) on the command line with the old falsecolor.pl , but I don't think these are available now with falsecolor2.exe... am I right? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ez1i6iyJXXM2L17h4BYiwawNh8Z1q37dkJjoZdCdBM1MUih6hVmKz9IDDZVr0ywqaczvRudrpAfKfC189gzIxaYuL21NycZ9/fc_pal.JPG) I am aware of the alternative old palette -spec but in the current HB false-colour component, but is that it ? Another question for Mingbo - I get the following error message when trying to open the attached HDR file with your amazing new viewer: 1. Solution exception:Parameter is not valid. Am I doing anything wrong ? I can see many useful applications to your pixel-value reader, especially if externally rendered HDR images can be loaded (which is the case here). Do they need a specific header to be "valid" ? Many thanks in advance for your help. Best, Jocelyn
topic: Processing HDR images / falsecolor2 palettes & the new image viewer

replies.body: Hi Jocelyn, I can only answer your HDR error question: I just tested your hdr file, it works fine on my side.  I am not sure what caused that error. I will test this file on my another computer tomorrow, and will let you know if I find the same error. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/DXrtOheepEEQ5alUzxYBGWNkVUzKsF*p0gbJuVXZrI0mY0gKLRJkHZuId99ZqJtL7yVRnKELPsdyMPXgdgXmNSVnrr9C7TLT/Capture.PNG) -Mingbo

Hi Mingbo,

Thanks for your reply.

That's odd, I have tested on another computer too and get the same error. 

Could it have to do with local save/admin rights etc? 

Thanks



Jocelyn

Just to comment that i can see the image too.
